item.title: Mary J. Blige - Live In Los Angeles
item.description: This well-shot concert DVD finds Blige running through twenty-two bouncy hits such as "Real Love" and therapeutic love songs from a catalog as deep as almost any other neosoul sister's.

item.title: Ren and Stimpy - The Complete First and Second Seasons
item.description: Whether picking boogers in a black hole or speaking Limburger on the cheese-o-phone, demented Chihuahua Ren and fat cat Stimpy up the insanity ante.

item.title: Dr. Strangelove: 40th Anniversary Special Edition
item.description: This blackest satire on the madness of war has grown more apt over time.

item.title: Going Upriver: The Long War of John Kerry
item.description: This excellent film presents a carefully burnished view of John Kerry's war and anti-war record - tracing his path from Swift-boat commander to protest leader.

item.title: Dawn of the Dead (Widescreen Unrated Director's Cut)
item.description: This remake of the George A.

item.title: Festival Express
item.description: In the summer of 1970, disparate acts including Buddy Guy, Sha Na Na and the Flying Burrito Brothers took a train across Canada to play a handful of outdoor concerts, their onboard jamming infused with the inertia of the locomotive and the countryside's bucolic beauty.
